body: @vjf You added the `mPrivate` field, so you probably have a good idea of what's going on and might be able to fix this.
There is an issue with tha latest version of pyassimp. I can reproduce it on Ubuntu. Thanks for the report.

issue.title: Fix "bytes aketrans" issues in Python>=3.1

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
Issue https://github.com/assimp/assimp/issues/2339

In Python>=3.1, pyassimp.load('filepath') will raise AttributeError: 'bytes' object has no attribute 'aketrans' because the field `mPrivate` is of type `bytes` and Python 3.1 introduced `bytes.maketrans` method (ref: https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.1.html#other-language-changes ).

Solution: in core.py, modify last condition of `_is_init_type(obj)` from `not isinstance(obj, int)` to `not isinstance(obj, (int, str, bytes))`.

body: I'm still getting this error in pyassimp 4.1.4 on Ubuntu and Python 3.7. It seems that the issue still exists. Or am I doing something wrong? Am I missing something?

SimonMaracine
try an older version. If it works maybe you need to look at the difference between it and the new version. I think I ended up changing one line to get it to work
You're right. Version 4.1.3 of pyassimp works. But I don't know how to look at the changes between the versions.

SimonMaracine
look at treyenelson's commented on Feb 15, 2019
That's how I managed to get it working.
@kimkulling Please reopen this issue until this regression is fixed

The workaround by @treyenelson still works:
> I tracked down the exact commit and line of code that introduce the error:
> 
> https://github.com/assimp/assimp/blob/0adc032f6983bc74f3556081c0b66f8fe874369d/port/PyAssimp/pyassimp/structs.py#L1088
> 
> Deleting that line resolves the error.
> Unfortunately, I lack the understanding of assimp and python c types to find the correct solution.

@vjf Any suggestions on how to solve this?

issue.title: Use POINTER(char) for binary data. For pyassimp issue #2339: Can't load OBJ

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
Found this in the ctypes documentation:
"For a general character pointer that may also point to binary data,
POINTER(c_char) must be used." c_char_p is for a zero-terminated string.

Reference: https://docs.python.org/3/library/ctypes.html#ctypes.c_char_p

Applying this change to the 4.1.4 release fixes #2339 for me in Ubuntu.
The issue isn't consistent since I can't reproduce it with master, but this
still appears to be a correct change since it does fix the 4.1.4 released code for me.

To confirm mPrivate points to binary data and not a string, it is set like this [here](https://github.com/assimp/assimp/blob/3fead344ad06446ce2dca9ea528fcca7b6948e35/code/Common/Version.cpp#L139):
`mPrivate(new Assimp::ScenePrivateData())`

issue.title: PyAssimp cannot load PLY

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Global flag to mark a deviation from expected behaviour

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
This appears to be similar to this [issue](https://github.com/assimp/assimp/issues/2339) while loading ply. I have tried both ASCII and binary formats which produce the same error. I am currently using pyassimp version 4.1.4.

```
'Traceback (most recent call last):\n',
'  File "pyassimp/core.py", line 321, in load\n    scene = _init(model.contents)\n',
'  File "pyassimp/core.py", line 216, in _init\n    call_init(obj, target)\n', 
'  File "pyassimp/core.py", line 84, in call_init\n    _init(obj,parent=caller)\n', 
'  File "pyassimp/core.py", line 212, in _init\n    setattr(target, name, obj)\n', 
"AttributeError: 'bytes' object has no attribute 'aketrans'\n"
```

issue.title: Update the version of PyAssimp on PyPI

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Global flag to mark a deviation from expected behaviour

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
Current version of PyAssimp on the PyPI doesn't work. It throws errors, because looks like at some point you try to access `aketrans` attribute of `bytes` (I guess typo from `maketrans` method of bytes class) object which is no longer an issue if I install package from `setup.py`.

So simply realeasing new version should fix this.
